gov.nasa.gsfc.nisgs.dsm
Class DSM

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.gsfc.nisgs.dsm.DSM
Direct Known Subclasses:
DSMAdministrator
public class DSM
extends java.lang.Object

DSM is an interface class to the DSM subsystem and database. It needs mysql-jdbc.jar.

The fetchProduct and reserveProduct methods all block when fetching or reserving products. The timeQuota and timeSleep parameters determine the times the DSM uses. If you are implementing multiple threads with different time blocking requirements, you should instantiate more than one DSM object.

Version:
3.0 Added support for transfer commands, 3.22 Fixed an infinite blocking problem in all fetchProduct methods.

Constructor Detail

DSM

public DSM(java.lang.String myGroup,
           java.lang.String myName)
    throws java.lang.Exception
Construct the DSM object. This is the preferred constructor. It will establish a network connection to the database server. This constructor expects certain information to be defined in system properties. This is the preferred constructor.
NISGS_HOME - The NISGS root directory. The constructor will look for the file nisgs.properties in this directory, and it will throw an exception if it is not found. You should define NISGS_HOME with a -D parameter when you run your java program. If you omit NISGS_HOME, then you must define the following system properties explicitly.
DSM_DATABASE_HOME - An IP address or host name for the DSM database. If you do not define it as a system property, the constructor will look for it in nisgs.properties. An explicit definition takes precedence over a nisgs.properties definition. If undefined in either case, the constructor throws an exception.
NISGS_SITE_NAME - The nickname used for this computer. It should be predefined in the DSM database. If you do not define it as a system property, the constructor will look for it in nisgs.properties. An explicit definition takes precedence over a nisgs.properties definition. If undefined in either case, the constructor throws an exception.

Parameters:
myGroup - Each program using the DSM should have a unique group name. The DSM uses the group name to mark products so as to keep track of which ones this program has already processed. See reserveProduct(). The DSM does not enforce the uniqueness of a group name.
myName - Each instance of this program should have a unique name to distinguish it from other instances in the same group. The DSM does not enforce uniqueness.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

DSM

public DSM(java.lang.String mySite,
           java.lang.String myGroup,
           java.lang.String myName,
           java.lang.String dbhost,
           java.lang.String dbuser,
           java.lang.String dbpassword)
    throws java.lang.Exception
Construct the DSM object. It will establish a network connection to the database server.

Parameters:
mySite - A name for the computer on which this program is running. Site names are (must be) predefined in the DSM, and all programs running on the same computer must use the same site name for that computer. Case is significant.
myGroup - Each program using the DSM should have a unique group name. The DSM uses the group name to mark products so as to keep track of which ones this program has already processed. See reserveProduct(). The DSM does not enforce the uniqueness of a group name.
myName - Each instance of this program should have a unique name to distinguish it from other instances in the same group. The DSM does not enforce uniqueness.
dbhost - The name of the computer or IP address where the database server resides.
dbuser - The database user name to be used to log into the database server.
dbpassword - The database password to be used to log into the database server.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

           java.lang.String myGroup,
           java.lang.String myName,
           java.lang.String dbhost)
    throws java.lang.Exception
Construct the DSM object. It will establish a network connection to the database server.

Parameters:
mySite - A name for the computer on which this program is running. Site names are (must be) predefined in the DSM, and all programs running on the same computer must use the same site name for that computer. Case is significant.
myGroup - Each program using the DSM should have a unique group name. The DSM uses the group name to mark products so as to keep track of which ones this program has already processed. See reserveProduct(). The DSM does not enforce the uniqueness of a group name.
myName - Each instance of this program should have a unique name to distinguish it from other instances in the same group. The DSM does not enforce uniqueness.
dbhost - The name of the computer or IP address where the database server resides.

setTimeQuota

public void setTimeQuota(int seconds)
Set the total amount of time in seconds that reserveProduct or fetchProduct waits before it gives up and returns null. Use Integer.MAX_VALUE to have them wait forever. The default is 300 seconds.

setTimeSleep

public void setTimeSleep(int seconds)
Set the number of seconds between attempts that reserveProduct or fetchProduct waits before trying to reserve or fetch a product. The default is 5 seconds.

public Product getProduct(java.lang.String productID)
                   throws java.lang.Exception

Parameters:

Returns:

getProduct

public Product getProduct(java.lang.String productType,
                          Pass pass)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Get the product object from the database for this product type and pass. No files are copied.

Parameters:
productType - A product type
pass - A pass
Returns:
A product of this product type and linked to the specified pass. If more than one product satisfies the conditions, it returns the first one that the database returns. It returns null if no product satisfies the conditions.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getProduct

public Product getProduct(java.lang.String productType,
                          Pass pass,
                          java.util.Date time)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Get the product object from the database for this product type and pass and with a start and end time that brackets this time. No files are copied. If more than one product satisfies the conditions, it returns the first one that the database returns.

Parameters:
productType - A product type
pass - A pass
time - A date and time
Returns:
A product of this product type, linked to the specified pass, and one that brackets the specified time. If more than one product satisfies the conditions, it returns the first one that the database returns. It returns null if no product satisfies the conditions.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

fetchProduct

public Product fetchProduct(java.lang.String productID)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Get a product by its unique product ID. The DSM copies the product to the local site, which is the same site as identified in the constructor. It waits for the product to appear on the IS.

Parameters:
productID - A product ID string that uniquely identifies a product. The database defines and assigns product IDs when products are stored.
Returns:
a Product object or null if the product is unavailable within the allotted time.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

fetchProduct

public Product fetchProduct(java.lang.String productType,
                            Pass pass)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Fetch the product for this product type and this pass. The DSM copies the product to the local site, which is the same site as identified in the constructor. It will poll the database and wait for the product to appear.

Parameters:
productType - A product type
pass - A pass
Returns:
A product of this product type and linked to the specified pass. If more than one product satisfies the conditions, it returns the first one that the database returns. It returns null if no product satisfies the conditions within the allotted time.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

                            Pass pass,
                            java.util.Date time)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Get the product for this product type and pass and with a start and end time that brackets this time. The DSM copies the product to the local site, which is the same site as identified in the constructor. It will poll the database and wait for the product to appear.

Parameters:
productType - A product type
pass - A pass
time - A date and time
Returns:
A product of this product type, linked to the specified pass, and one that brackets the specified time. If more than one product satisfies the conditions, it returns the first one that the database returns. It returns null if no product satisfies the conditions within the allotted time.

reserveProduct

public Product reserveProduct(java.lang.String productType,
                              java.lang.String otherTypes)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
Get a product of type productType that is unmarked by this group. It marks the product with this group name. The DSM copies the product to the local site, which is the same site as identified in the constructor. This method blocks waiting for a product.

Parameters:
productType - A product type
otherTypes - space-separated list of other product types
Returns:
A product or null if no unmarked product of this type is available.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

reserveProduct

public Product reserveProduct(java.lang.String agroup,
                              java.lang.String productType,
                              java.lang.String otherTypes)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
Get a product of type productType that is unmarked by this group. In this version of reserveProduct(), you may use a different group name, which may be useful in programs that run multiple threads. This method marks the product with this group name. It blocks. The DSM copies the product to the local site, which is the same site as identified in the constructor.

Parameters:
agroup - A group name
productType - A product type
otherTypes - space-separated list of other product types
Returns:
A product or null if no unmarked product of this type is available.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

reserveProductLikeProductType

public Product reserveProductLikeProductType(java.lang.String productTypeMask,
                                             java.lang.String otherTypes)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
Reserve a product that is unmarked by this group in which the product's type matches the product type mask. This method marks the product with this group name. It blocks. The DSM copies the product to the local site, which is the same site as identified in the constructor.

Parameters:
productTypeMask - A product type search pattern in SQL format. Use SQL pattern matching syntax. SQL pattern matching allows you to use `_' to match any single character and `%' to match an arbitrary number of characters (including zero characters). SQL patterns are case-insensitive by default.
otherTypes - space-separated list of other product types
Returns:
A product or null if no unmarked product of this type is available.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

reserveProduct

public Product reserveProduct(java.lang.String productType,
                              java.lang.String otherTypes,
                              double granuleDuration,
                              int prePostCount)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
Get a product of type productType that is unmarked by this group, and products temporally before and after it. It marks the product with this group name. The DSM copies the product to the local site, which is the same site as identified in the constructor. This method blocks waiting for a product.

Parameters:
productType - A product type
otherTypes - A space-separated list of other product types
granuleDuration - Time in seconds. The previous Product must contain the mainProduct.startTime - granuleDuration/2, and the next Product must contain the mainProduct.stopTime + granuleDuration/2.
prePostCount - The number of granuleDuration-sized intervals to be checked before and after the main product's temporal extent.
Returns:
A product or null if no unmarked product of this type is available.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

reserveProduct

public Product reserveProduct(java.lang.String productType,
                              java.lang.String otherTypes,
                              java.lang.Double granuleDuration,
                              java.lang.Integer prePostCount)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
This version of reserveProduct takes boxed numeric types as arguments, to make it callable by Dsm_command.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

reserveProduct

public Product reserveProduct(java.lang.String productType,
                              java.lang.String otherTypes,
                              java.lang.Double granuleDuration)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
This version of reserveProduct takes boxed numeric types as arguments, to make it callable by Dsm_command, and it defaults prePostCount to 1 (the usual case of one granule before and after the main one).

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

java.lang.Exception

addDataResource

public void addDataResource(Product prod,
                            java.lang.String path)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Adds a "DATA" resource path to prod. If we are on the IS host, and the incoming path begins with the IS directory, remove it - IS DATA resources go into the database as paths relative to the IS (presumably FTP) directory.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getProductDirectory

public java.lang.String getProductDirectory(java.lang.String productType)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
Returns the appropriate directory for this product type and host. If we are on the IS host, return the is_directory for this product type (or the dropbox if this type is unknown). Otherwise return an empty string

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

deleteProductResource

public boolean deleteProductResource(java.lang.String filename)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Delete a product resource file reference that is on this site. It deletes the entry from the database, but it does not delete the file. It does not affect any copy of this file existing on other computers.

Parameters:
filename - The name of the file without directory information. For example, "file.dat', not "dir/dir1/dir2/file.dat".
Returns:
true if it worked and false if no file by that name exists in the database.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

addResource

public void addResource(java.io.File file,
                        Product product,
                        java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.String site,
                        java.lang.String comment)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Add a new resource file to an existing product in the database. Do NOT use it to add a resource to a product that is not yet in the database.

Parameters:
file - The file name to be added. It must be fully qualified with directory information.
product - The product to which the resource will be added.
key - A keyword to identify the product. Each resource has a unique keyword within a product. The primary resource is usually called "DATA." The capsule resource is "capsule." Use a short, case- sensitive name such as "image", "CREC", etc. The name should be unique within a product type.
site - The site where the resource is located. (NISDS1, NISDS2, for example.) You may set this argument to null in which case the method uses the local site name. Most applications will use null.
comment - A short phrase that describes the resource. It is optional, and you may pass null for this argument.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

createPass

public java.lang.String createPass(Pass pass)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
Put a pass into the DSM database. It will insert the pass id into the Pass object.

Parameters:
pass - A pass object to be inserted into the database
Returns:
the database pass ID
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getPass

public Pass getPass(java.lang.String spacecraft,
                    java.util.Date time)
             throws java.lang.Exception
Get a pass for a spacecraft such that the time is within (inclusive) the pass's AOS and LOS. If more than one station has a pass that satisfies the conditions, it is uncertain which pass the DSM will return.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getPass

public Pass getPass(java.lang.String spacecraft,
                    java.util.Date startTime,
                    java.util.Date stopTime)
             throws java.lang.Exception
Get a pass for a spacecraft such that its start and stop times exactly match the specified ones.

Parameters:
spacecraft - a spacecraft name
startTime - a date and time
stopTime - a date and time
Returns:
a Pass or null if no pass in the database qualifies
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getPass

public Pass getPass(java.lang.String spacecraft,
                    java.lang.String station,
                    java.util.Date time)
             throws java.lang.Exception
Get a pass for a spacecraft and station such that the time is within (inclusive) the pass's AOS and LOS.

Parameters:
spacecraft - a spacecraft name
station - a station name
time - a date and time
Returns:
a Pass or null if no pass in the database qualifies
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

findPass

public Pass findPass(java.lang.String spacecraft,
                     java.util.Date startTime,
                     java.util.Date stopTime)
              throws java.lang.Exception
Find a pass for a spacecraft such that its start and stop times surround the specified ones - aos <.= startTime, los >.= stopTime. Returns the best fit (defined as smallest time interval that fits).

Parameters:
spacecraft - a spacecraft name
startTime - a date and time
stopTime - a date and time
Returns:
a Pass or null if no pass in the database qualifies
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getStation

public Station getStation(java.lang.String name)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Get a station by name from the Stations table.

Parameters:
name - a unique name for the station, which is in the database
Returns:
a Station object or null if the station is not in the table
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getStaticAncillary

public java.lang.String getStaticAncillary(java.lang.String akey)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Get a static ancillary data file associated with a unique label. The DSM copies the file to the local site (computer).

Parameters:
akey - a unique key string associated with the file
Returns:
The path name of the file or null if no file exists.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

putStaticAncillary

public void putStaticAncillary(java.lang.String label,
                               java.lang.String path)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
Put a static ancillary file into the DSM database. The DSM assumes the file is on the local computer. It does not verify the file's existence.

Parameters:
label - A unique keyword that identifies this file
path - The path name of the file. It must include directory information. It may be just a directory (such as DEM) that contains ancillary files. When storing files from the Information Services (IS) computer, use a relative directory name that is relative to the root of the anonymous ftp directory tree.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

putStaticAncillary

public void putStaticAncillary(java.lang.String label,
                               java.lang.String path,
                               java.lang.String description)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
Put a static ancillary file into the DSM database. The DSM assumes the file is on the local computer. It does not verify the file's existence.

Parameters:
label - A unique keyword that identifies this file
path - The path name of the file. It must include directory information. It may be just a directory (such as DEM) that contains ancillary files. When storing files from the Information Services (IS) computer, use a relative directory name that is relative to the root of the anonymous ftp directory tree.
description - a file description
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

putTimedAncillary

public void putTimedAncillary(java.lang.String key,
                              java.util.Date time,
                              java.lang.String path)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
Put a timed ancillary file into the DSM database. The DSM assumes the file is on the local computer. It does not verify the file's existence.

Parameters:
key - A unique keyword that identifies this type of file. All files of the same type must use the same keyword. "UTCPOLE" and "LEAPSEC" are the keywords for those file types.
time - A date and time for the file
path - The path name of the file. It must include directory information. It may be just a directory (such as DEM) that contains ancillary files. When storing files from the Information Services (IS) computer, use a relative directory name that is relative to the root of the anonymous ftp directory tree.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getTimedAncillary

public java.lang.String getTimedAncillary(java.lang.String key,
                                          java.util.Date time)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
Get a timed ancillary file for time nearest to the passed time. Defaults the TimeWindow to "any time" The DSM copies the file to the local site (computer).

Parameters:
key - A unique keyword that identifies this type of file
time - A date and time for the file
Returns:
The path name of the file or null if no file exists.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getTimedAncillary

public java.lang.String getTimedAncillary(java.lang.String key,
                                          java.util.Date time,
                                          TimeWindow tw)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
Get a timed ancillary file for time nearest to the passed time that also matches the TimeWindow The DSM copies the file to the local site (computer).

Parameters:
key - A unique keyword that identifies this type of file
time - A date and time for the file
tw - A TimeWindow object
Returns:
The path name of the file or null if no file exists.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

putSatTimedAncillary

public void putSatTimedAncillary(java.lang.String key,
                                 java.util.Date time,
                                 java.lang.String spacecraft,
                                 java.lang.String path)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
Put a spacecraft-time ancillary file into the DSM database. This type of ancillary file is mapped by spacecraft, time, and a keyword. The DSM assumes the file is on the local computer. It does not verify the file's existence.

Parameters:
key - A unique keyword that identifies this type of file. All files of the same type must use the same keyword. "drl.tle" is the keyword for TLE files.
time - A date and time for the file
spacecraft - A spacecraft name
path - The path name of the file. It must include directory information. It may be just a directory (such as DEM) that contains ancillary files. When storing files from the Information Services (IS) computer, use a relative directory name that is relative to the root of the anonymous ftp directory tree.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getSatTimedAncillary

                                             java.util.Date time,
                                             java.lang.String spacecraft)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception

Parameters:
key - A unique keyword that identifies this type of file
time - A date and time for the file
spacecraft - A spacecraft name
Returns:
The path name of the file or null if no file exists.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

putUTCPOLE

public void putUTCPOLE(java.util.Date time,
                       java.lang.String path)
                throws java.lang.Exception
Put a UTCPOLE file into the DSM database. The DSM assumes the file is on the local computer. It does not verify the file's existence.

Parameters:
time - The date and time of the UTCPOLE file.
path - The path name of the file. It must include directory information. It may be just a directory (such as DEM) that contains ancillary files. When storing files from the Information Services (IS) computer, use a relative directory name that is relative to the root of the anonymous ftp directory tree.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getUTCPOLE

public java.lang.String getUTCPOLE(Product product)
                            throws java.lang.Exception

Parameters:
product - A product
Returns:
The path name of the file or null if no file exists.

java.lang.Exception

deleteTimedAncillary

public boolean deleteTimedAncillary(java.lang.String filename)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Delete a time ancillary file reference that is on this site. (LEAPSEC and UTCPOLE are time ancillary types.) It deletes the entry from the database, but it does not delete the file. It does not affect any copy of this file existing on other computers.

Parameters:
filename - The name of the file without directory information. For example, "file.dat', not "dir/dir1/dir2/file.dat".
Returns:
true if it worked and false if no file by that name exists in the database.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getTLE

public java.lang.String getTLE(java.util.Date time,
                               java.lang.String spacecraft)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
Get a TLE file for the spacecraft and time nearest to the TLE time. The DSM copies the file to the local site (computer).

Parameters:
time - A date and time for the TLE
spacecraft - The spacecraft name
Returns:
The path name for the TLE file or null if no TLE for that spacecraft exists.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getTLE

public java.lang.String getTLE(Product product)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
Get a TLE file for a product. It extracts the time and spacecraft from the product. The DSM copies the file to the local site (computer).

Parameters:
product - A product
Returns:
The path name for the TLE file or null if no TLE for that spacecraft exists.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

public boolean deleteTLE(java.lang.String filename)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Delete a TLE file reference that is on this site. It deletes the entry from the database, but it does not delete the file. It does not affect any copy of this file existing on other computers.

Parameters:
filename - The name of the file without directory information. For example, "file.dat', not "dir/dir1/dir2/file.dat".
Returns:
true if it worked and false if no file by that name exists in the database.

java.lang.Exception

deleteFileRecord

public boolean deleteFileRecord(java.lang.String pathname,
                                boolean do_commit)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Deletes DSM records of a file Throws exceptions if it can't communicate to the database.

Parameters:
pathname - String (must be an absolute pathname).
do_commit - boolean (if true, really do the record deletion)
Returns:
true if the file is safe to delete, false if it's not.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

deleteFileRecord

public boolean deleteFileRecord(java.lang.String pathname)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Default case is, yes, we want to commit.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

removeOldMarkers

public int removeOldMarkers(java.lang.String pid)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Removes entries from Markers table that may have been left over from a previous run/crash of an NCS station. Returns the number of entries removed (0 or 1 in all but the weirdest cases).

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

                                java.lang.String posttime,
                                java.lang.String predate,
                                java.lang.String postdate)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Returns a TimeWindow object, suitable for passing in to getTimedAncillary or getSatTimeAncillary

java.lang.Exception

                      throws java.lang.Exception
